images.description: Bug types are often based on insects and tend to evolve early in games.
Dark types were added to counter Psychic dominance and have sneaky moves.
Dragon types are typically powerful with high base stats and iconic legendaries.
Electric types are strong against Flying and commonly have high speed.
Fairy types were introduced to balance Dragon types and often have healing moves.
Fighting types excel at physical attacks and counter Normal and Rock types.
Fire types are strong against Grass and Ice and often learn powerful special moves.
Flying types are commonly paired as a secondary type and are immune to Ground.
Ghost types are immune to Normal and Fighting and have eerie, spectral designs.
Grass types often use status and healing moves but commonly have many weaknesses.
Ground types are immune to Electric attacks and often learn Earthquake as a staple move.
Ice types are powerful offensively but suffer from several common weaknesses.
Normal types have diverse movepools but lack strong type advantages.
Poison types often inflict status effects and pair well with Fairy types.
Psychic types were extremely strong in early generations before many counters were added.
Rock types commonly boast high defense and are often found in mountainous areas.
Steel types have many resistances and are prized for their durability.
Water types are the most common and appear in a wide variety of forms and abilities.
